Description: Curved clapper in the form of a left hand and forearm with an elaborate incised bracelet: inscribed with hieroglyphs, the hand has a broken thumb. The elongated fingers have the nails carved out, and there is a slight depression between each of the digits. The wrist shows an elaborate bracelet. The curved forearm is rounded at the end and pierced with a hole.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W.M.F. Petrie, 'Diospolis Parva' (1901), pp. 51 [77], 53 [83,84], and pl.xxvii. The right hand is in the Chicago Oriental Institute, no. 5518; B. Porter and R. B. L. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography', v (1937), p. 109
